title: Vault Root Hierarchy Counting Logic
details:
HIERARCHY COUNTING LOGIC - CRITICAL UNDERSTANDING:

When given a vault path like "d:\source\notebook-automation\test-vault-structure\Projects\MBA", the MBA folder is treated as LEVEL 1 (vault root).

The hierarchy counting ALWAYS starts from the supplied vault root at LEVEL 1, ignoring all previous path components:
- Level 1: MBA (vault root - uses "main" template, shows "Programs" section)
- Level 2: MBA subfolders like "Digital Program" (uses "program" template, shows "Courses" section)  
- Level 3: Course folders like specific courses (uses "course" template, shows "Modules" section)
- Level 4+: Module/content folders (uses "module" template)

KEY FIXES NEEDED:
1. Update DetermineTemplateType() hierarchy mapping:
   - 1 => "main" (vault root)
   - 2 => "program" 
   - 3 => "course"
   - 4 => "class"
   - 5+ => "module"

2. Update special content folder detection to hierarchyLevel >= 5

3. Update main program folder detection to level 1

4. Update CalculateHierarchyLevel to return 1 for vault root, not 0

The CalculateHierarchyLevel method needs to be adjusted to start counting from 1 instead of 0.
